Key Match Events: Mark Vientos hit a grand slam in the second inning, loading the bases with two outs and walking Francisco Lindor.
Post-Match Reflections: Mark Vientos showed poise and confidence, hitting a grand slam to rally the Mets and even the series at one game apiece.
Vientos has matched Daniel Murphyâ€™s total of 11 RBIs in the playoffs and is one shy of the Mets record of 12, shared by Curtis Granderson and John Olerud.
Vientos' performance further cemented his place as one of the top October performers in Mets history.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Vientos has hit six multihit efforts in nine playoff games, tying for ninth in Mets history with 14 hits overall in a single postseason.
The Mets' second grand slam this month came less than a week after Lindor's NLDS Game 4 shot, making them one of 13 teams to hit multiple slams in a postseason.
Vientos' slam occurred immediately after an intentional walk, one of only four such occurrences this century.
